717956f-a.title: Manhattan: Avenue C - 12th Street (East)
717956f-a.text:
(1 & 2)
Avenue C, west side, north from East 12th to 14th Streets,
and showing in the foreground a vacant space where No. 199-801
Avenue C formerly stood, and which recently collapsed. No. 2
shows same in detail.
March 24, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A view showing solely the 13th to 14th Streets block. Note
also a recent demolition here in the Gity's slum condemnation
Drogram.
March 24, 1938.
P. L. Sperr

711118f-a.title: Manhattan: 12th Street (East) - Avenue C
711118f-a.text:
E. 12th St., at the N. E. corner of Ave. C., showing neighborhood
youths loitering under airing bed clothes.
March 24, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,

711119f-b.title: Manhattan: 12th Street (East) - Avenue C
711119f-b.text:
(1)
East 12th Street, west from Avenue C. Note clearances in
this slum area; that,on the right being where a four story tenement
collapsed around ebruary 1938.
March 24, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
No's 639 to 647 East 12th Street, north side, west of Avenue
C. These buildings appear on the right of View No. 1; the photo-
grapher viewing same northward from the clearance on the opposite
side.
March 24, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The vacant space to the west of View 8 that includes the
sites of former Nos. 629 to 637 inclusive. The condemned four
story front and rear buildings shown are Nos. 627.

711120f-a.title: Manhattan: 12th Street (East) - Avenue C
711120f-a.text:
E. 12th t., south side, east from (No. 644) a point slightly
west of Ave. C., and across same to the East River, showing a clearance
where several tenements (No.'s 648 to 654 inclusive) formerly stood.
Aarch 24, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,
